intro: Leschenaultia formosa var. oblata, commonly known as the silverleaf leschenaultia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery, fuzzy foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its unique texture and color.
